items.title: All NASA News - NASA
items.content_text: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

items.content_text: Resources for news media, including NASA news contacts and archived news material

items.title: NASA Selects Two Heliophysics Missions for Continued Development - NASA
items.content_text: NASA has selected one small explorer mission concept to advance toward flight design and another for an extended period of concept development.

items.title: NASA Astronaut Jonny Kim, Crewmates Return from Space Station - NASA
items.content_text: NASA astronaut Jonny Kim returned to Earth on Tuesday alongside Roscosmos cosmonauts Sergey Ryzhikov and Alexey Zubritsky, wrapping up an eight-month science

items.title: 2025 News Releases - NASA
items.content_text: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

items.title: Expedition 74 Crew Promotes Innovation with Stem Cell and Space Tech Research - NASA
items.content_text: Stem cells, materials research, and a technology demo topped the research schedule for the Expedition 74 crew on Thursday. The seven International Space Station residents also worked on a host of lab maintenance including Japanese cargo operations and preparations for upcoming rack transfers.

items.title: Station Trio Back on Earth; Expedition 74 Keeps Up Science, Maintains Systems - NASA
items.content_text: Expedition 73 has ended and NASA astronaut Jonny Kim has returned to Houston and Roscosmos cosmonauts Sergey Ryzhikov and Alexey Zubritsky have returned to Moscow. Expedition 74 is now underway with veteran NASA astronaut Mike Fincke as commander.

items.title: NASA JPL Unveils Rover Operations Center for Moon, Mars Missions
items.content_text: The center leverages AI along with JPL’s unique infrastructure, unrivaled tools, and years of operations expertise to support industry partners developing future planetary surface missions.

items.title: New NASA Sensor Goes Hunting for Critical Minerals
items.content_text: Called AVIRIS-5, it’s the latest in a long line of sensors pioneered by NASA JPL to survey Earth, the Moon, and other worlds.

items.title: Invention Challenge Brings Student Engineers to NASA JPL
items.content_text: Now in its 26th year, the event brings teams of middle and high school students to the lab to compete with home-built contraptions.

items.title: NASA Selects 2 Instruments for Artemis IV Lunar Surface Science
items.content_text: The JPL-led South Pole Seismic Station will enable scientists to characterize the lunar interior structure to better understand geologic processes that affect planetary bodies.

items.title: NASA Completes Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope Construction
items.content_text: Set to launch by May 2027, the spacecraft will study mysteries of the cosmos while also testing the Coronagraph Instrument, a new technology designed and built by JPL.

items.title: NASA Rover Detects Electric Sparks in Mars Dust Devils, Storms
items.content_text: Perseverance confirmed a long-suspected phenomenon in which electrical discharges and their associated shock waves can be born within Red Planet mini-twisters.

items.title: NASA Tests Drones in Death Valley, Preps for Martian Sands and Skies
items.content_text: Next-generation drone flight software is just one of 25 technologies for the Red Planet that the space agency funded for development this year.

items.title: NASA Orbiter Shines New Light on Long-Running Martian Mystery
items.content_text: Results from an enhanced radar technique have demonstrated improvement to subsurface observations of Mars.

items.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
items.content_text: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

items.title: November 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: Throughout November, the Terran R program made key advancements across design, build, test, and launch operations. items.title: SES, Relativity Space Expand Multi-Launch Agreement for Terran R
items.content_text: New contract adds launch services for SES’s GEO or MEO satellites

items.title: October 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: As Terran R development continues to advance, we’re excited to share updates from October across design, build, test, and launch. items.title: September 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: The Terran R program continues to build momentum, and September delivered meaningful progress across design, manufacturing, testing, and launch.
